title: Authors and Citation
text: Raymond B, Ickowicz (2023). sfsclient: Synology File Station client. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sfsclient: Synology File Station client},   author = {Ben Raymond and Adrien Ickowicz},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Synology File Station client
text: R package providing minimal Synology File Station client.

title: Synology File Station client
code: library(sfsclient)  ## provide user and pass directly, or via environment variables SFS_USER and SFS_PASS sfs <- sfs_connect("https://my.sfs-domain.com/webapi", user = "myusername", pass = "mypassword")  ## list shared folders sfs_list_share(sfs)  ## list folder contents sfs_list(sfs, "/some/shared/folder")  ## download file or folder sfs_download(sfs, "/some/path/file.png")

what: Connect to a Synology File Station — sfs_connect
title: Connect to a Synology File Station — sfs_connect
Connect to a Synology File Station — sfs_connect
code: sfs_connect(url, user, pass, version = 0L, verbose = sfs_verbose())

title: Connect to a Synology File Station — sfs_connect
text: url string: URL connect , e.g. "https://.sfs.com/webapi/" user string: username. missing, taken environment variable `SFS_USER` pass string: password. missing, taken environment variable `SFS_PASS` version integer: SYNO.Api.Auth version use. 0, `sfs_info(url)$SYNO.API.Auth$maxVersion` called determine appropriate value use (adds second two connection time) verbose logical: give debug info?

title: Connect to a Synology File Station — sfs_connect
Connect to a Synology File Station — sfs_connect
Download files or folders — sfs_download
code: sfs_download(   sfs,   path,   out_dir,   mode = "download",   progress = TRUE,   verbose = sfs_verbose() )

title: Download files or folders — sfs_download
text: sfs sfsclient: returned [sfs_connect()] path character: one file folder paths (starting shared folder. Probably needs start "/") out_dir string: destination directory. provided, temporary directory used mode string: "download" (default) "open" progress logical: show download progress? verbose logical: give debug info?

title: Retrieve File Station information — sfs_fs_info
text: sfs sfsclient: returned [sfs_connect()] verbose logical: give debug info?

title: Retrieve File Station information — sfs_fs_info
text: list, information potentially including * is_manager - logged-user administrator * support_virtual_protocol - types virtual file system logged user able mount (CIFS, NFS, ISO) * support_sharing - logged-user can share files/folders * hostname - host name

what: Retrieve API information from a Synology File Station — sfs_info
title: Retrieve API information from a Synology File Station — sfs_info
text: Retrieve API information Synology File Station

title: Retrieve API information from a Synology File Station — sfs_info
Retrieve API information from a Synology File Station — sfs_info
text: url string sfsclient: URL connect , e.g. "https://.sfs.com/webapi/", sfsclient object verbose logical: give debug info?

title: Retrieve API information from a Synology File Station — sfs_info
Retrieve API information from a Synology File Station — sfs_info

what: List files in a shared folder — sfs_list
title: List files in a shared folder — sfs_list
List files in a shared folder — sfs_list
code: sfs_list(sfs, path, additional = c("time", "size"), verbose = sfs_verbose())

title: List files in a shared folder — sfs_list
text: sfs sfsclient: returned [sfs_connect()] path string: folder path. Probably needs start "/" additional character: one "real_path", "size", "owner", "time", "perm", "type", "mount_point_type" verbose logical: give debug info?

title: List files in a shared folder — sfs_list
List files in a shared folder — sfs_list
List shared folders — sfs_list_share
text: sfs sfsclient: returned [sfs_connect()] additional character: one "real_path", "owner", "time", "perm", "mount_point_type", "sync_share", "volume_status" verbose logical: give debug info?

what: Search files according to given criteria — sfs_search_start
title: Search files according to given criteria — sfs_search_start
Search files according to given criteria — sfs_search_start
code: sfs_search_start(   sfs,   path,   recursive = TRUE,   pattern = NULL,   extension = NULL,   verbose = sfs_verbose() )  sfs_search_list(   sfs,   taskid,   additional = c("time", "size"),   clean = TRUE,   verbose = sfs_verbose() )  sfs_search_stop(sfs, taskid, verbose = sfs_verbose())  sfs_search_clean(sfs, taskid, verbose = sfs_verbose())

title: Search files according to given criteria — sfs_search_start
text: sfs sfsclient: returned [sfs_connect()] path string: one folder paths. Probably needs start "/" recursive logical: search recursively? pattern string: search files whose names extensions match case-insensitive glob pattern. `pattern` contain glob syntax ("?" "*"), "*" added begin end string automatically partially matching pattern. can use " " separate multiple glob patterns extension string: Search files whose extensions match file type pattern case-insensitive glob pattern. give criterion, folders matched. can use commas "," separate multiple glob patterns. verbose logical: give debug info? taskid string: search task ID returned `sfs_search_start` additional character: one "real_path", "size", "owner", "time", "perm", "type", "mount_point_type" clean logical: search finished, stop search process remove temporary database? Note `sfs_search_list` requests issued `taskid`

title: Search files according to given criteria — sfs_search_start
Search files according to given criteria — sfs_search_start
Set global sfsclient verbosity — sfs_verbose
text: convenience function sets verbosity level `sfsclient` functions, without explicitly set function call.

title: Set global sfsclient verbosity — sfs_verbose
text: called parameters, current verbosity setting. Otherwise sets value returns
